name: Grange St. Paul's Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a one night stay here on Sunday 12th September through lastminute.com, secret hotel rate of £90.00. Absolute bargain, it was fabulous. Ideally situated near to St Paul's cathedral and the Millennium Bridge this is a relatively new hotel that, as yet, has not been truly discovered (thus stated our taxi driver!) Beautiful glass elevators take you to your floors, affording you a view of the wonderful restaurants below (didn't have an opportunity to try out but they looked great). Although our view was of the block opposite this didn't matter a jot. The room was excellent, spotless, robes and slippers included, together with a turn down service. Best shower I have ever had with three variations of downpour! There is a rooftop garden with bar which has a super view of the cathedral.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The piece de resistance, though, has to be the pool, spa and gym - fantastic! Brand spanking new gym equipment, the like of which I have never seen, an entire room of top of the range spinning bikes and for those feeling less like exercise and more in need of relaxation, fab' changing rooms, 20m swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi, steam rooms, etc etc all included in the price!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay - Definately a 5* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all - can't wait to go back - longer stay next time!
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for two nights when attending a friends wedding near by. Its a grand hotel with a nice atmosphere and modern feel to it.
reviews.title: Shocking service

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean, luxurious and comfortable - definitely what I would expect from a 5* hotel. The bathroom was spotless and had a fantastic shower and separate bath.
reviews.title: Ill conceived, ill executed and ill managed

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel several times now and each time I am very impressed. It's tucked away from the main road so it's fairly quiet.
reviews.title: Hidden Oasis

reviews.text: It's very new and the decor is modern but not too minimalist so still very comfortable. The rooms are a nice size, some have a fabulous view of St Paul's which is especially spectacular at night when it's lit up. It has nice bars and restaurants and it has a really nice pool and spa area including a Jacuzzi, Hamman and various other aroma therapy rooms, as well as that it has really nice products in both the rooms and the spa.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in a twin room so that me and my friend can stay, there are no narrow little single beds in this hotel, every time I have stayed you get two big beds (Queen size or even King size, I'm not sure). It's nice to get in after dinner to find the curtains closed and the beds turned down, just all the little touches that make you feel a bit special.
reviews.title: Really nice

reviews.text: The main thing at this hotel though is that it is spotless and you often see staff cleaning during the daytime in the common areas which I don't notice that often. The staff are very attentive and they always have plenty of people on which is good if you've ever waited for half an hour in a check-out queue.
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.text: Overall I would say this is a bit of a gem!
reviews.title: Not impressed.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely love this hotel. We stayed here through a cheap deal as one of lastminute.com's top secret hotels and we amazed at what a beautiful hotel it is. The communal areas are stunning - especially the enormous glass atrium, and we loved the cocktail bar (although they were quite slow making the cocktails!). The rooms are also lovely - very plush and comfortable with a view over the atrium rather than a car park or heating system that you often get with hotels!
reviews.title: Stunning hotel!!!!

reviews.text: Location is excellent - a minute's walk from St Pauls Cathedral with plenty of places to eat and drink close by.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.text: The hotel also boasts an amazing spa and pool which we didn't realise before getting there so we didn't use it. However we are going there again this weekend and I definitely plan to use it.
reviews.title: great gym and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great 3 night stay at this modern and stylish hotel. Had booked a room with twin beds which turned out to be fantastic. Two large (double to queen size) beds with great bed linen. The bathroom was beautiful with a wonderful shower and gorgeous Molton Brown products. Big wardrobe with plenty of storage. We had an initial problem with some sort of noise coming from the ceiling but this was quickly fixed by maintenance staff whilst we were out during the day. Lovely buffet breakfast with plenty of choice. On our last night we had a light meal in the bar which was very satisfying and not overly priced by London standards. The location of this hotel is superb with just a short walk to St Paul's tube station. The free WIFI was great with good connection speeds and no drop outs. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Wow!!! FAB HOTEL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to move to this rather new hotel some time ago (i am in London once a month) from Malmaison, which did not have a nice gym. Grange is a big hotel with a very modern (ugly...) reception zone (poor staff working there must get crazy from the light of the screens!). It's a functional business hotel, but i would ask for a room in the front building. Quiet and practical for a fair price (...in London), as it is just in front of St-Paul. Main restaurant was ok, but not high gastronomy. Newly opened is a japanese style restaurant (well, it's acutally american). Always fun to see an idian trying to cook japanese food. 2 very positives in the hotel: the large bar and spa zone. First go to the amazing gym, then to the pool, then to the sauna and after that spend time in the nice "sport-bar" like zone drinking some beers (by the way, staff at the bar could get a bit more "service-education", they are nice but not all are very competent). Negative: waiting time when checking in or out, i feel like in the post office...and of course i hate it when asked every month "is it the first time you check in with us"
reviews.title: Lacking supervision

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel two weeks ago and we booked a superior room which was roomy and felt comfortable. however there were no slippers and only one bathrobe.
reviews.title: overpriced and under serviced

reviews.text: We then booked to take the children with us, arrived and went to an executive room, which to our horror was the same size with 2 beds in, it did have a shower and a bath that was the only good part. two bathrobes for 4 people, 2 pairs of slippers for 4 people,2 cups for 4 people now your getting the message. No iron in the room, phone never worked, the list goes on,breakfast my wife goes to with my eldest daughter and no tea and toast after requesting it three yes three times.
reviews.title: New modern hotel near St Pauls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel could be so good but service needs to be as good as the location.
reviews.title: AMAZING, DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel but maybe 4 star on the looks and how modern it is but will get as good service in the local ymca
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Placed in a good position for the City, near St Pauls, the Monument and the Thames this hotel is also near the central line for Oxford Street and the shops. One of the amazing 'Grange' group who keep their prices reasonable, are enthusiastic about service and supply good rooms. My room had a wonderful shower and large bath - what more could you want after trooping around London all day?
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: Given the reviews on this website I had chosen the hotel. First the only plus, you cannot go wrong with the location. It is across the Saint Paul's cathedral, next to London's main tourist information booth, 2 minutes from tube and 5 minutes from the Museum of London and surrounded by some of the best restaurants. 5 minutes walk to the millennium bridge with view of the Thames. We got a pretty decent and spacious room but when you pay $420/night, this is the least you expect. Now the many negatives: We stayed for six days (which is a fairly long stay to judge the quality of a hotel); we got breakfast only first two days and after that there was no breakfast. When I asked the manager he said (grumpily), "That was part of the booking." I said, I had booked on their website and the website did not make any mention of only two days of breakfast. I was with my 11 year old and they said, "OK, he can eat whatever he wants to but you can only eat continental." Also, the pool is unavailable to children except for a few hours on weekdays (why???). The staff was fairly friendly. No early check-in and they charged $100 for a local telephone call. When I complained they said that since I had dialed the country code, the phone read it as a national call. I told them that I had called someone living in London and the number was local, the removed only part of the charge. I still had to pay $50 for a local phone call! While I liked the location, I will probably not stay at this hotel again but (a) find a cheaper option or (b) look for a different hotel in the price range.
reviews.title: Great location but skimming on basic things

reviews.text: I stayed here with 10 of my friends on my hen do in June 2013 so the hotel was actually part of a package deal.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: When we arrived we were all taken back at how posh it looked! The rooms were big and clean and the beds were the most comfy things I've ever slept on! The shower was amazing and the bathroom was very clean.
reviews.title: A great hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were so helpful, I forgot my toothbrush and found down reception and at 2am they brought me a over night kit with all the essentials!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!...

reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning was superb! So much choice.
reviews.title: A Change of Heart - tired hotel and tired after night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked as a secret hotel on lastminute. Asked for a room with a view and got it (327) staff facilities and room all top class. Will definitely stay again and the location is superb. 2 minutes from tube station
reviews.title: Fantastic
Comfortable Cool Hotel in Great Location
reviews.text: Overlooking St.Pauls , this hotel is in a great location 10 minutes from Bank. The staff are really friendly , professional and the service, rooms and facilities were excellent. Will be staying again !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here on Friday 7th June with my wife as we were celebrating me and seven colleagues leaving the Met Police. When I made my reservation on Lastminute.com, I made a request to the hotel that, as it was a special occasion, could we have a room looking at St. Pauls Cathedral. We were not dissapointed. On opening the curtains in the room on our arrival, there was the magnificent St.Pauls right in front of us. The only problem though, was that we couldn't have the curtains open, because our room was on a corner and everyone in the offices oiutside could see straight into the room. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and lovely bathroom. Other than that, the hotel is very modern and spotless, but you should expect that from a 5*. We didn't try the health club or the restaurant so cannot comment on that. We did try to have a drink at the bar on our return to the hotel at midnight but the bar was packed with workers all showing off trying to see who could spend the most money. It was so noisy and I can imagine the atmosphere getting aggressive at times looking at some of the drunks there. Might be wrong. We decided to take our drinks to our room. The bar was not the place to have a relaxing drink. Staff at reception seemed a bit robotic and weren't too friendly but check in/ check out was fast. Do check the prices on Lastminute.com as they are a lot cheaper than the hotel, especially if you choose one of their Top Secret Hotel offers as we did for £99. It's not too difficult to work what hotel you'll be staying at. Overall an excellent hotel across the road from St.Pauls.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 days, I was in London for business. Rooms are a nice size and comfortable. Located close to St. Paul's Cathedral and a few minutes walk to the tube station. I enjoyed the bar and service and food at the Japanese restaurant was great. The lobby is quite welcoming there is ample space to sit and have a drink. The staff is very friendly. The price is also reasonable.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff
Great hotel at amazing price
reviews.text: This is a very nicely designed hotel, for a very good price in a great location. I stayed only one night and loved the bar, the room, and especially the nice shower. But what I appreciated the most is the honesty of the staff: I inadvertently left my iPad mini on the room, the housekeeping staff fund it and turned it in... I know all of that should be a given but..I still do not under estimate how well run the hotel must be for that to happen. (I sent a thank you note to the hotel manager and was hoping he'd pass it on .. But since I have heard nothing from him, I'd like to thank again the house keeping and guest relation staff for being just outstanding)

Very smart hotel, good breakfast & helpful staff. The location is brilliant,round the corner from St Pauls, across the road from the Millenium Bridge which is a stones throw away from the Tate & the Globe Theatre. The spa is a really nice bonus with a nice pool & variuos treatments & steam rooms
reviews.title: Great value & great location & in London City Too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern & user friendly very accessible for wheel chair users & lots of sitting areas
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel ?

reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed here.
reviews.title: Good location, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Grnage for the 1st time for my husbands 40th birthday. When we arrived I asked if I could organise/pay for a birthday cake and upgrade to a room with a view. The very helpful man on reception gave me the phone number of guest services as they were all in a meeting and told me to call them to arrange later (all in a meeting at the same time ??) I called later to be told that I could get a very small cake for £30 and that they would put me on standby for a view. When we checked in later we were given a room with a view of a brick wall in a side street.
reviews.title: A great stay in the City of London

reviews.text: Only other points were a mouldy sandwich had been left in the minibar (been in there a while I think) and there was only 2 sugar sachets and 1 bathrobe for a double room. A nice hotel but guest services weren't very accomodating and the mouldy sandwich/lack of tea and coffee items weren't very 5 star.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, below average concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel, great location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice and have a good decent shower and are a reasonable size. Located right next to St. Paul's Cathedral. Slippers and Bathrobes provided in rooms, and Spa Area is very nice and relaxing.
reviews.title: Great Hotel , perfect location

reviews.text: Close to tube station which gives great access to greater London.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel and Location
Awesome location & really nice staff
reviews.text: Really cool lobby when you entye the hotel for the first time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar is open 24 hours which is great for a late drink after being out on the town, also cocktails are really good.
reviews.title: Nice city break hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a college reunion weekend in London. The hotel was first class, the staff were helpful, the rooms were very comfortable, there was plenty of room in the lounges for large groups and the breakfast (continental was more than adequate.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise, lovely stay

description: With a sophisticated blend of contemporary style and modern flair, the stunning Grange St. Paul’s Hotel sets new standards for luxury and elegance. Perfectly located in the heart of the City’s financial district yet just moments from the myriad delights of London’s renowned West End, the Grange St. Paul’s provides a perfect venue for any visit to the capital. Deluxe bedrooms and suites provide the ultimate in understated elegance and luxury, whilst a spectacular glass Atrium holds an unrivalled selection of restaurants and bars.
